result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Miller

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:00 PM Defendant Michael D Miller in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to his waiver of right to an attorney.
The Defendant wishes to waive his right to an attorney.
The Court finds that the Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waiving his right to an attorney.

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.


The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COSTS: $243.00
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
   -  to be paid in 30 days or civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment of fine.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

09:29 AM Defendant Michael D Miller in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
